overview: From 2025-10-20 to 2025-10-21, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 20 new PRs (3 merged), 6 new issues, and 34 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Improve `op-up` so it can serve as a sysgo runner during development
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body:
Since we're deprecating Kurtosis, we need a new tool for developers to quickly spin up a local devnet. The current candidate for this is `op-up`, but probably a few modifications are necessary to make it feasible for local development.

- We want to have a few presets and/or flags/env-vars so that individual components can be turned on or off (e.g. batcher, proposer, challenger, number of validators, op-reth/geth, ...)
- We want to directly spin up the in-memory sysgo-based components without the need to build a Docker container
    - We probably want to assign a few static ports (optionally configurable) so developers can reliably find the same components at the same ports. Those could be different than the standard ports.
- Related: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17941

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] Investigate why block right after genesis still has 0 gas scalar
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body: In current tests, block 1 after genesis still has a 0 gas scalar. But it should have the default scalar already. Current tests skip the first block because of this.

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] Add action proof tests
topIssues.author: sebastianst

topIssues.title: feat(tests): enable observability/monitoring in sysgo.
topIssues.author: theochap
topIssues.body:
## Context

The rust protocol team is using sysgo to hold long-running, in memory, instances of op-stack devnets for quick feature iteration and network health monitoring.

We would like to add observability into our devnets - for instance, collect metrics emitted by CL/EL into grafana dashboards. There are several ways to do that:

- Since the devnets are spawn using random OS ports - we'll need to parse the ports each node has bound to and forward the metrics port to a grafana instance.
- We could also provide a port mapping as an input of sysgo, a bit like in the `syext` mode. This would allow us to run sysgo's devnet in a docker container (no port conflicts), and deterministically map the ports to a grafana instance.

topIssues.title: op-node: maxSafeLag not working
topIssues.author: KyrinCode

topPRs.title: Add safe compatibility tests
topPRs.author: JosepBove
topPRs.body: Adds a base contract to inherit when doing safe compatibility tests. It has 2 helper functions to do the testing the Verbose one is superchain-ops style to use while developing to see where everything is failing, the one that does not have Verbose on it is the one expected on tests but will fail on the first encountered revert.

topPRs.title: test: Check game args after opcm.updatePrestate for v2 games
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
Updates the `OPContractsManager_UpdatePrestate_Test` test to ensure that disputegame-v2 game parameters are setup correctly when the `DEPLOY_V2_DISPUTE_GAMES` feature flag is enabled.

Once `opcm.addGameType` supports disputegame-v2, we can follow up to remove the `vm.skip` call for that feature flag.

part of: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17261

topPRs.title: opcm-standard-validator: Re-enable tests for v2 contracts, validate proposer
topPRs.author: mbaxter
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
This PR updates `OPContractsManagerStandardValidator` (StandardValidator) to include validation for the `proposer` on `PermissionedDisputeGame`'s, and it re-enables and updates tests for the StandardValidator when the `DevFeatures.DEPLOY_V2_DISPUTE_GAMES` feature flag is enabled.

This PR builds on a few previous PRs:
-  #17782 - which is needed to set up tests correctly
-  #17874 - which introduced updates to `OPContractsManagerStandardValidator` to read some game parameters from the new `gameArgs` mapping in `DisputeGameFactory`.

**Tests**

Tests have been re-enabled and updated.

**Metadata**
Closes #17267

topPRs.title: Improvements to SaferSafes styling
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
This PR makes various changes which bring the LivenessModule2 and TimelockGuard contracts into alignment stylistically. 

It is best reviewed one commit at a time to see what is being changed.

topPRs.title: ci: Use a fixed version of mise in golang docker builds
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Fix the version of mise used in docker builds.

This may wind up being a different version to what's installed by circleci-utils but at least it's under control. We can follow up to have a single source of truth about the version to use in the future.
